data.title: Olav V of Norway (The Lost Prince)

data.text:

HRH Princess Ingrid Alexandra

Olav V born Prince Alexander of Denmark; 2 July 1903 – 17 January 1991) was the King of Norway from 1957 until his death in 1991.

Olav was the only son of King Haakon VII of Norway and Maud of Wales. He became heir apparent to the Norwegian throne when his father was elected King of Norway in 1905. He was the first heir to the Norwegian throne to be brought up in Norway since Olav IV in the fourteenth century, and his parents made sure he was given as Norwegian an upbringing as possible. In preparation for his future role, he attended both civilian and military schools. In 1929, he married his first cousin Princess Olga of Greece and Denmark. During World War II his leadership was much appreciated and he was appointed Norwegian Chief of Defence in 1944. Olav became king following the death of his father in 1957.

Owing to his considerate, down-to-earth style, King Olav was immensely popular, resulting in the nickname no: Folkekongen ('The People's King'). In a 2005 poll by the Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation, Olav was voted "Norwegian of the Century"

Marriage, Affairs and fatherhood[]

Affairs with sister-in-law[]

Olav was amazed of the beauty of his wife Olga’s younger sister, Marina, who got married the next day of their wedding. Amazed by Marina’s beauty, Marina’s husband, Alexander cooperate with Olav and they deliberately let their own wife drunk, and guided them to each other’s room respectively.

Olav had sex with Marina that night, Marina became his woman and conceived with his children. Marina was shocked the next morning and met her also shocked elder sister, Olga, who had sex with Alexander. The two sisters felt guilty to each other and see each other frequently.

After their own wife gave birth to children of them, Olav and Alexander cooperate again and started to neglected their own wife, at their children’s baptism, Olav comforted Marina, had a deep talk with her and Marina fell down on Olav, Marina kissed Olav passionately, the two made out in the corridor and kissed while going back to the bedroom and ended up having sex together. After that, Marina, who fell for Olav, became his long-term mistress.

After a few years of affairs which Olga and Marina both request of having conceptive measures in order to hide their affairs from their husbands, Olav and Alexander cooperate the third time, they booked rooms next to each other, deliberately punctured their condoms, set them up with drinks that contained aphrodisiac, Marina and Olga drank it and had a passionate sex with them, they were conceived once again and produced another illegitimate children.
